quote: Personally, I believe “Young Adult” to be an arbitrary title that means the book "Can be enjoyed by anyone/Has a main character who’s not quite an adult/Isn’t really boring.
author: Shannon Hale

quote: Youth is the gift of nature, but age is a work of art.
author: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec

quote: You become mature when you become the authority of your own life.
author: Joseph Campbell,  A Joseph Campbell Companion: Reflections on the Art of Living

quote: In the United States today, there is a pervasive tendency to treat children as adults, and adults as children. The options of children are thus steadily expanded, while those of adults are progressively constricted. The result is unruly children and childish adults.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: A young child is a leader to an elderly person once his purpose has a faithful, sincere and trustworthy influence on people. Leadership is not restricted to position and age; it is self-made and influencial. Everyone has this self-leadership quality.
author: Israelmore Ayivor

quote: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young.
author: Henry Ford

quote: The creative adult is the child who has survived.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quote: I believe that maturity is not an outgrowing, but a growing up: that an adult is not a dead child, but a child who survived. I believe that all the best faculties of a mature human being exist in the child. . . . that one of the most deeply human, and humane, of these faculties is the power of imagination.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Language of the Night: Essays on Fantasy and Science Fiction

quote: Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up ’cause they’re looking for ideas.
author: Paula Poundstone

quote: There is a fountain of youth: it is your mind, your talents, the creativity you bring to your life and the lives of people you love. When you learn to tap this source, you will truly have defeated age.
author: Sophia Loren

quote: Enjoy your youth.You'll never be younger thanyou are at this very moment.
author: Chad Sugg

quote: Grown ups are complicated creatures, full of quirks and secrets.
author: Roald Dahl

quote: I’m 33, and an 18-year-old girl called me old. I said, “You may be temporarily young, but you’ll forever be childish.” Then I put gum in her hair.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: It takes a very long time to become young.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.
author: Pat Monahan

quote: Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.
author: Margaret Atwood,  Cat's Eye

quote: You're only young once, but you can be immature forever
author: Germaine Greer

quote: I don't know how I look, but I know how I feel: Young. Goofy. Infinite.
author: John Green,  Paper Towns

quote: You are only young once, but you can stay immature indefinitely.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: You are never too old to become younger!
author: Mae West

quote: Youth is not a time of life; it is a state of mind; it is not a matter of rosy cheeks, red lips and supple knees; it is a matter of the will, quality of the imagination, a vigor of the emotions; it is the freshness of the deep springs of life.
author: Samuel Ullman

quote: Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: I want young people to know that they can belong - whatever your culture, your religion, your sexuality - that you can live life how you want to live it and feel comfortable how you are.
author: Jessie J

quote: I'm not young enough to know everything.
author: J.M. Barrie,  The Admirable Crichton

quote: Daring to make a difference in today's youth-one page at a time
author: william sawyers

quote: You can learn at any age.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Immature artists imitate. Mature artists steal.
author: Lionel Trilling

quote: You are as young as your self-confidence, as old as your fears; as young as your hope, as old as your despair.
author: Samuel Ullman

quote: The youth is the hope of our future.
author: Jose Rizal

quote: In your pursuit of your passions, always be young. In your relationship with others, always be grown-up.
author: Tom Brokaw

quote: The secret of staying young is to be simple and happy like a child.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: ...inside every old person is a young person wondering what happened.
author: Terry Pratchett,  Moving Pictures

quote: Before I begin, may I ask how old you are?""You may ask.""How old are you?""It's none of your business
author: Christopher Pike,  The Last Vampire

quote: You know I'm old in some ways-in others-well, I'm just a little girl. I like sunshine and pretty things and cheerfulness-and I dread responsibility.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  This Side of Paradise

quote: Age does not make us childish, as some say; it finds us true children.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Growing old is mandatory. Growing up is optional.
author: Carroll Bryant

quote: If you liked being a teenager, there's something really wrong with you.
author: Stephen King

quote: I happen to be immature, undisciplined, and self-centered, pretty much a little boy in a man's body, although I'd appreciate it if you didn't quote me on that.-Bobby Tom
author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips,  Heaven, Texas

quote: When I was growing up I always wanted to be someone. Now I realize I should have been more specific.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: People talk to old people like they're children.'Oh you're very old aren't you?' Yeah I'm old. I'm not stupid.
author: Craig Ferguson

quote: Whose little boy are you?
author: James Baldwin,  The Fire Next Time

quote: I am not young enough to know everything.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I am of old and young, of the foolish as much as the wise,Regardless of others, ever regardful of others,Maternal as well as paternal, a child as well as a man,Stuffed with the stuff that is course, and stuffed with the stuff that is fine, one of the nation, of many nations, the smallest the same and the the largest
author: Walt Whitman,  Song of Myself

quote: The complexities of adult life get in the way of the truth. The great philosophers have always been able to clear away the complexities and see simple distinctions - simple once they are stated, vastly difficult before. If we are to follow them we too must be childishly simple in our questions - and maturely wise in our replies.
author: Mortimer J. Adler,  How to Read a Book: The Classic Guide to Intelligent Reading

quote: Although I'm only fourteen, I know quite well what I want, I know who is right and who is wrong. I have my opinions, my own ideas and principles, and although it may sound pretty mad from an adolescent, I feel more of a person than a child, I feel quite indepedent of anyone.
author: Anne Frank,  The Diary of Anne Frank

quote: At the age of four, I wanted to be eight. At the age of eight, I wanted to be 16. At the age of 16, when I started driving, I wanted to be a Ferrari. And now, at the age of middle, I want to be Stalin’s mustache and matching armpit hair. But only for personal reasons, not political.
author: Jarod Kintz,  A Story That Talks about Talking Is Like Chatter to Chattering Teeth, and Every Set of Dentures Can Attest to the Fact That No..

quote: To exist is to change, to change is to mature, to mature is to go on creating oneself endlessly.
author: Henri Bergson

quote: I hope that there's a difference between being childish and childlike and that I'm the latter, if you take my meaning. I often sort of wonder. I don't think I'm a terribly good grown-up; I don't take responsibility easily or well in many areas of life. Finance and stuff like that, I'm absolutely appalling.
author: Graeme Base

quote: Caring - about people, about things, about life - is an act of maturity.
author: Tracy McMillan
